title: Arvato commissions first solar power plant in the USA - DC Velocity
summary: Arvato, a supply chain and e-commerce service provider, has installed a solar power plant on the roof of its Ontario distribution center, generating 800,000 kWh of clean electricity annually. This project, part of Arvato's commitment to carbon neutrality by 2030, utilizes a Purchase Power Agreement (PPA) to reduce electricity costs while supporting Bertelsmann's overall sustainability goals.
likely_naics_codes: ['493110 - Electric Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution', '488490 - Other Support Activities for Transportation', '531120 - Lessors of Real Estate', '423830 - Wholesale Trade of Electrical Equipment, Appliances, and Supplies']
greenwashing: There is no evidence of greenwashing in the article, as the company clearly states its commitment to sustainability and the environmental benefits of the solar power plant installation.

title: How Mattiq Uses Data and AI to Advance The Electrolyzer Technology, and Interview with Hydrogen Central - Hydrogen Central
summary: Mattiq, a materials science and AI company, is developing new materials to reduce or eliminate iridium in PEM electrolyzers, thus making green hydrogen production more affordable and scalable. Their approach involves synthesizing and testing tens of thousands of materials per day, accelerating the development and deployment of these electrochemical systems. Mattiq is also forming partnerships with industry players to bring these solutions to market.
likely_naics_codes: ['325991 - Other Chemical Product Manufacturing', '333914 -  Electromedical and Electrotherapeutic Apparatus Manufacturing', '541710 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences', '541990 -  All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services']
greenwashing: The described innovation is not an example of greenwashing, as Mattiq is transparently working towards reducing the reliance on expensive and rare materials in green hydrogen production.
